intro: Rinorea aylmeri, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height, characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature, contributing to its natural distribution. Rinorea aylmeri is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
